definition: state enterprise/(Tw) abbr. for 國際企業管理|国际企业管理, international business management (as a subject of study)
to plan a project/to stand on tiptoe/Taiwan pr. [qi4]/abbr. for 企業|企业[qi3 ye4]

sentences.english: If this problem can't be solved, the reforms of state-owned enterprises can't go well.
sentences.chinese: 這個問題解決不好，國企改革就會難以徹底。

sentences.english: The threshed incentive conditions are thereby presented in this article.
sentences.chinese: 並且定量地給出了國企經理的“門檻型激勵條件”。

sentences.english: Tellingly, the Bailian Group, China’s biggest retailer, is state-owned.
sentences.chinese: 比如說中國最大的零售企業上海百聯集團就是國企。

sentences.english: The effort to privatize state-owned enterprises turned into an enrichment scheme for cronies of the regime.
sentences.chinese: 而國企私有化則成了政權姻親的致富模式。

sentences.english: There is also practically no innovation coming from the state enterprises that dominate industry.
sentences.chinese: 此外，佔國家工業主導地位的國企幾乎沒有創新性。

sentences.english: The soe problem is also solving itself through attrition.
sentences.chinese: 國企還正在通過精兵簡政來解決自身的問題。

sentences.english: You serve as an executive at state-owned enterprises in steel and communications.
sentences.chinese: 你在分管鋼鐵和通信的國企擔當主管人員。

sentences.english: Away from the eastern seaboard, the state sector still dominates.
sentences.chinese: 然而遠離東部沿海的地區，國企仍占主導地位。

sentences.english: The government decided the only solution was to bail the state enterprise out.
sentences.chinese: 政府認爲惟一的解決辦法是幫助該國企擺脫困境。

sentences.english: Thus, to study the performance of the work groups in state-owned enterprises is very important.
sentences.chinese: 於是，對於國企班組團隊效能的研究就顯得十分重要。

sentences.english: Wu works for a State-owned corporation in Chengdu, capital of Sichuan province.
sentences.chinese: 吳婷在四川省會成都的一家國企工作。

sentences.english: Of course, we can’t estimate the magnitude of such SoE lending.
sentences.chinese: 當然我們無法估計此類國企轉貸的規模。

sentences.english: It has been devising market-access rules that favour state firms.
sentences.chinese: 國家正在制定有利於國企的市場準入制度。

sentences.english: Employees believing in Atheism in private enterprises are less in number than those in SOEs.
sentences.chinese: 民企員工認同科學無神論的人數少於國企員工。

sentences.english: The lending from the state-owned enterprises may have kept many private companies from going bankrupt.
sentences.chinese: 國企轉貸或許讓很多民企避免了破產之憂。

sentences.english: This is the duty that every enterprise, and especially every transnational enterprise, has to society.
sentences.chinese: 這是每一個企業特別是跨國企業對社會應盡的責任。

definition: to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
